sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"说，讲"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: say, speak, state, talk, tell, utter
means: say ： 最普通常用词，指用语言表达思想，着重所说的内容。
speak ： 侧重于说话动作的本身，着重说话的能力而不在内容，可以是长篇大论的演讲，也可以是三言两语的交谈，甚至指简单的开口发声说话。
state ： 较正式用词，通常指用明确的语言或文字着重地叙述事实，既强调内容又注重语气。
talk ： 普通用词，侧重指与人交谈时的连续说话，可指单方面较长谈话，和speak一样，着重说活动作而不侧重内容。
tell ： 普通用词，指把某事告诉或讲述给某人听，口语或书面语均可用。
utter ： 着重说话的行为，常指声音的使用，突出用噪子发声。

list.explanation: 断然鄙弃、不接受(某人的某事物)

example.en: She told me rudely what to do with my proffered assistance.
example.zh: 她粗暴地断然拒绝了我提供的协助。

entry.def: If you tell someone something, you give them information.

example.ex: In the evening I returned to tell Phyllis our relationship was over...
example.tran: 晚上我回来告诉菲莉丝我们之间完了。

example.ex: I called Andie to tell her how spectacular the stuff looked...
example.tran: 我打电话告诉安迪，那东西看上去太棒了。

entry.def: If you tell something such as a joke, a story, or your personal experiences, you communicate it to other people using speech.
entry.tran: 说(笑话);讲(故事);讲述(个人经历)

example.ex: His friends say he was always quick to tell a joke...
example.tran: 他的朋友们说，以前他讲笑话总是张嘴就来。

example.ex: He told his story to The Sunday Times and produced photographs...
example.tran: 他把自己的经历讲述给了《星期日泰晤士报》的记者，还提供了照片。

entry.def: If you tell someone to do something, you order or advise them to do it.

example.ex: A passer-by told the driver to move his car so that it was not causing an obstruction...
example.tran: 一个过路人叫那个司机把他的车挪一挪，免得挡道。

example.ex: She told me on the telephone to come help clean the house.
example.tran: 她在电话里叫我过去帮忙打扫屋子。

entry.def: If you tell yourself something, you put it into words in your own mind because you need to encourage or persuade yourself about something.

example.ex: 'Come on', she told herself...
example.tran: “加油！”她在心里暗暗打气。

example.ex: I told myself I would be satisfied with whatever I could get.
example.tran: 我告诉自己，不管得到什么我都会心满意足的。

entry.def: If you can tell what is happening or what is true, you are able to judge correctly what is happening or what is true.

example.ex: It was already impossible to tell where the bullet had entered...
example.tran: 已经无法判断子弹是从哪里打进来的。

example.ex: I couldn't tell if he had been in a fight or had just fallen down...
example.tran: 我不知道他是和人家打架了，还是仅仅摔了一跤。

entry.def: If you can tell one thing from another, you are able to recognize the difference between it and other similar things.

example.ex: I can't really tell the difference between their policies and ours...
example.tran: 我真的看不出他们的政策和我们的有什么不同。

example.ex: How do you tell one from another?...
example.tran: 你怎么把他们区分开来？

entry.def: If you tell, you reveal or give away a secret.

example.ex: Many of the children know who they are but are not telling.
example.tran: 许多孩子知道他们是谁，可就是不说。

entry.def: If facts or events tell you something, they reveal certain information to you through ways other than speech.

example.ex: The facts tell us that this is not true...
example.tran: 事实告诉我们，这不是真的。

example.ex: I don't think the unemployment rate ever tells us much about the future...
example.tran: 我认为，从失业率上永远看不出未来的情况究竟如何。

entry.def: If an unpleasant or tiring experience begins to tell, it begins to have a serious effect.
entry.tran: (不快的或令人疲倦的经历)产生效果，产生影响

example.ex: The pressure began to tell as rain closed in after 20 laps...
example.tran: 跑完 20 圈以后，眼看就要下雨了，大家开始紧张起来。

example.ex: The strains of office are beginning to tell on the prime minister.
example.tran: 首相开始感到公务繁忙的压力了。

entry.def: You use as far as I can tell or so far as I could tell to indicate that what you are saying is based on the information you have, but that there may be things you do not know.

example.ex: As far as I can tell, Jason is basically a nice guy...
example.tran: 据我所知，贾森算得上是个好人。

example.ex: So far as anyone can tell, there's evidence that there was a Robin Hood...
example.tran: 众所周知，有证据表明确实有罗宾汉这么个人。

entry.def: You can say 'I tell you', 'I can tell you', or 'I can't tell you' to add emphasis to what you are saying.
entry.tran: (用来强调所说的话)我可以肯定/我敢说/我没法形容

example.ex: I tell you this, I will not rest until that day has come...
example.tran: 我可以肯定地说，不到那天我不会休息。

example.ex: This little letter gave us a few chuckles, I can tell you...
example.tran: 说真的，我们看了这封短信都笑了。

entry.def: If you say 'You never can tell', you mean that the future is always uncertain and it is never possible to know exactly what will happen.

example.ex: You never can tell what life is going to bring you.
example.tran: 你永远不知道人生会给你带来些什么。

entry.def: If someone disagrees with you or refuses to do what you suggest and you are eventually proved to be right, you can say 'I told you so'.
entry.tran: 我早就告诉过你;我说的没错吧

example.ex: Her parents did not approve of her decision and, if she failed, her mother would say, 'I told you so.'
example.tran: 她父母不赞同她的决定，要是她失败了，她妈妈就会说：“怎么样，我说对了吧？”

entry.def: You use I'll tell you what or I tell you what to introduce a suggestion or a new topic of conversation.
entry.tran: 我的建议是，听我说(用来引出建议或转换话题)

example.ex: I tell you what, I'll bring the water in a separate glass.
example.tran: 要不这样吧，我用另一个玻璃杯把水端过来。

sentences.sentence: "He said that he wanted to marry her"
"Tell them that you will be late"

means.word_mean: 3. narrate or give a detailed account of;

sentences.sentence: "The father told a story to his child"

means.word_mean: 4. give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority;

sentences.sentence: "I said to him to go home"
"She ordered him to do the shopping"
"The mother told the child to get dressed"
"He could tell that she was unhappy"

means.word_mean: 6. inform positively and with certainty and confidence;

sentences.sentence: "I tell you that man is a crook!"
"he was telling on all his former colleague"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tellan 'relate, count, estimate', of Germanic origin; related to German zählen 'reckon, count', erzählen 'recount, relate', also to tale
